rev.desc.rev.desc: update panel update.record, set trigger error exit to $error
Recompiling, as a new parameter (Workflowhase) was added to the alert.schedule RAD application.
It seems that SM mismatch the following two fields in the environemnt.ocml.g/environment.ocmq.g/environment.ocmo.g form design:
1)skip.warning
2)full.name
modify update.current panel to fix this issue
Changed the following expression on the 'start' panel:
From: $L.ocml.query="parent.quote=\""+number in $L.file+"\""
To: $L.ocml.query="parent.quote=\""+number in $L.file+"\" and status~=\"cancelled\""
DE1452 - Changed the condition from if (evaluate($L.i in conditions in $L.category)=true and $L.start=false) to if ($L.cond)=true and $L.start=false) to consider nulls
Added the $L.file.save variable to parameters passed to alert.schedule.
Added $L.file to the Quote/Order Record parm on the fix.phaselog panel.
Added "save" to the Mode parm on the schedule.alerts panel.

Modifications made to panels fix.phaselog and get.first.phase; new panel added called get.first.phase.0. These changes take care of the phase log entries when reopening a closed request, accounting for phase conditions.
Added better error messages when a record has been modified by an ouside resource.
Same change as below to check.for.subupd.

On check.master.fc, changed exit condition from 1 in 3 in fc.func in $L.fc.master and name in $L.fc.master~=name in $L.fc to 1 in 3 in fc.func in $L.fc.master and not same(name in $L.fc.master, name in $L.fc).
Updated notify to pass in $L.file.save. dup.file now gets called after all the messages are processed, right before exit.normal.
Nullsubed $ocmo.events and $ocmq.events to {} on setup.events panel.
Now calls get.base.form.name to set up the format control name. The master.fc field in the object record is referenced instead of the filename to select the master format control record.
Changed exit on check.approval.recalc to allow alerts to be processed regardless of what settings are in effect for approvals.
Added old subtotal code.

descript.descript: update panel update.record, set trigger error exit to $error
Recompiling, as a new parameter (Workflowhase) was added to the alert.schedule RAD application.
It seems that SM mismatch the following two fields in the environemnt.ocml.g/environment.ocmq.g/environment.ocmo.g form design:
1)skip.warning
2)full.name
modify update.current panel to fix this issue
Changed the following expression on the 'start' panel:
From: $L.ocml.query="parent.quote=\""+number in $L.file+"\""
To: $L.ocml.query="parent.quote=\""+number in $L.file+"\" and status~=\"cancelled\""
DE1452 - Changed the condition from if (evaluate($L.i in conditions in $L.category)=true and $L.start=false) to if ($L.cond)=true and $L.start=false) to consider nulls
Added the $L.file.save variable to parameters passed to alert.schedule.
Added $L.file to the Quote/Order Record parm on the fix.phaselog panel.
Added "save" to the Mode parm on the schedule.alerts panel.
recompile
Added better error messages when a record has been modified by an ouside resource.
Same change as below to check.for.subupd.

On check.master.fc, changed exit condition from 1 in 3 in fc.func in $L.fc.master and name in $L.fc.master~=name in $L.fc to 1 in 3 in fc.func in $L.fc.master and not same(name in $L.fc.master, name in $L.fc).
Updated notify to pass in $L.file.save. dup.file now gets called after all the messages are processed, right before exit.normal.
Nullsubed $ocmo.events and $ocmq.events to {} on setup.events panel.
Now calls get.base.form.name to set up the format control name. The master.fc field in the object record is referenced instead of the filename to select the master format control record.
Changed exit on check.approval.recalc to allow alerts to be processed regardless of what settings are in effect for approvals.
Added old subtotal code.
